name: Saltmarch Flats
role_in_state: Primary salt and kelp supplier; shallow-water pilotage hub
economy_niches: solar and kiln salt evaporation pans
kelp drying and seaweed processing for food and binding reagents
fish curing and salted fish exports
reed/sedge harvest for rope, mats, thatch
shallow-draft piloting and local navigational auguries
culture_adjustments: communal, tide-timed salt-harvest rites distinct from ship-guild rites
strong pilot/poller identity over shipwright prestige
diet and dress adapted to high-salinity environment (preserving, salted staples)
matrilineal control of family-run salt pans common
practical augury focused on evaporation tides rather than long voyages
constraints: scarce fresh water limits agriculture and expansion
fragile marsh ecology restricts large-scale construction
ritual-magic reliant on imported reagents increases export pressure
notes: harvest calendar tied to spring tides and lunar-solar markers
salt landlords often exert maritime charter influence
